vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
συναρπάζω,
future -άσω[Refs 5th c.BC+], -άσομαι [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—snatch and carry away with one, carry clean away, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ὁ κρατῶν ἅμα πάντα σ. [Refs 5th c.BC+]; seize and retain, οὐ δύνανται συναρπάζειν αἱ μῆτραι τὸν γόνον [Refs 5th c.BC+]“Aër.” 21: metaphorically, carry away with one (by persuasive arguments), ξυναρπάσας στρατόν [Refs 5th c.BC+]; οὐδένα ὑμῶν συναρπάζω I am not 'rushing' you, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; σ. ἑαυτὸν εἰς τὸ ἄνω, of mystical union with the One, [Refs 3rd c.AD+]:—passive, to be seized and carried off, βία ξυναρπασθεῖσαν [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 ξ. Χεῖρας seize and pin them together, [Refs 5th c.BC+] —middle, ξ. τινὰ μέσον, of a wrestler, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__3 metaphorically, ξ. φρενί seize with the mind, grasp, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; σ. τὸ ζητούμενον, in arguing, to be guilty of a petitio principii, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; so συνήρπασται εἰς κτητικὴν σύνταξιν is hastily concluded to have a possessive force, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__4 carry away, destroy all traces of, τι [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__5 passive, of persons, συνηρπασμένοι having been robbed, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to seize; (passive) to be caught, seized
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to seize; (passive) to be caught, seized
pluperf., συνηρπάκειν, to snatch up, clutch; to seize and carry off suddenly, Acts 6:12; to seize with force and violence, Lk. 8:29; Acts 19:29; passive of a ship, to be caught and swept on by the wind, Acts 27:15*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: asir, agarrar ; arrastrar ; (voz pasiva) ser llevado o arrastrado fuera de curso (por el viento)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: bắt; kéo theo; kéo bằng lực. σύν (G4862) + ἁρπάζω (G726)
